tool.name: Filter otus from otu table
tool.description: Filter OTUs from an OTU table based on their observation counts or identifier
tool.command: filter_otus_from_otu_table.py -i '$input_fp' -o '$output_fp' #if $negate_ids_to_exclude: --negate_ids_to_exclude #end if #if $min_count: -n '$min_count' #end if #if $min_count_fraction: --min_count_fraction='$min_count_fraction' #end if #if $max_count: -x '$max_count' #end if #if $min_samples: -s '$min_samples' #end if #if $max_samples: -y '$max_samples' #end if #if str($otu_ids_to_exclude_fp) != 'None': -e '$otu_ids_to_exclude_fp' #end if

param.label: -i/--input_fp: the input otu table filepath in biom format
param.name: input_fp

param.label: --negate_ids_to_exclude: keep OTUs in otu_ids_to_exclude_fp rather than discard them [default:False]
param.name: negate_ids_to_exclude

param.label: -n/--min_count: the minimum total observation count of an otu for that otu to be retained [default: 0]
param.name: min_count

param.label: --min_count_fraction: fraction of the total observation (sequence) count to apply as the minimum total observation count of an otu for that otu to be retained. this is a fraction, not percent, so if you want to filter to 1%, you specify 0.01. [default: 0]
param.name: min_count_fraction

param.label: -x/--max_count: the maximum total observation count of an otu for that otu to be retained [default: infinity]
param.name: max_count

param.label: -s/--min_samples: the minimum number of samples an OTU must be observed in for that otu to be retained [default: 0]
param.name: min_samples

param.label: -y/--max_samples: the maximum number of samples an OTU must be observed in for that otu to be retained [default: infinity]
param.name: max_samples

param.label: -e/--otu_ids_to_exclude_fp: file containing list of OTU ids to exclude: can be a text file with one id per line, a text file where id is the first value in a tab-separated line, or can be a fasta file (extension must be .fna or .fasta) [default: None]
param.name: otu_ids_to_exclude_fp
